text: Poured out of a 16 oz can, a light foam clings to the glass. The flaxen color is quite lucid, with moderate carbonation. The flavor reveals notes of sourdough pretzels and grapefruit.? The crisp, wheaty taste is quite nice on a warm spring day. The finish very clean, with little alcohol residual. A very authentic tasting Bavarian style wheat beer. Cheers Urban Chestnut!

Bought as a four-pack of 16floz cans for $6.50, there is no freshness found on this particular can. This traditional lager is very light and in color with clarity and has good foam retention. Nose possesses that wet grass and dirt aroma characteristic for the style. Sometimes when I have this beer it will come off a bit skunky, even though it is perfectly fresh. Palate is medium, yet full of mineral and fibrous flavors that is suitable for those times when you want a gritty golden lager.
Lightly hazy straw orange with a white head. Medium bodied with a carbonated bite. Earthy, light dough malt and some noble hop notes. Simple. Nice.

Bottle, as "Hallertauer Serie #2 Zwickel Hell", brewed in Wolnzach. Hazy golden color with nice white head. Aroma is sulphuric, flowery, grassy, bready yeasts and crackery malts. Taste is the same. Supremely drinkable. Very nice Zwickl, one of the best from Altbayern.

Hazy golden coloured body with a nice rich, thick seven centimetre tall pure white head. Aroma of grass, hay, mellow english and/or german hops, some nuttiness, a lot of floral elements and a plain honey sweetness noticeable close to the end. Light-Bodied; Strong grassy and very herbal flavours at first with a dose of citrus and coriander seed freshness, but a pale hop flavour follows and finishes with a dash of light spices/herbs. Aftertaste is mellow and floral, but a lot of grassy flavours and sweetness show through towards the end, as well. Overall, a nice and refreshing beer that shows well when its hot outside! This is my first Zwickel since being in Wien last year, and it was well worth the wait - a nice option to have if you like the style and cant get to Austria. I sampled this sixteen ounce can purchased from New Beer Distributors in New York, New York on 21-January-2017 for US$3,00 sampled at home in Washington on a hot 21-April-2017.

Pours a cloudy gold with decent eggshell head that leaves a foamy collar of lace. Nose involves sweet pale malt, musty cellar, light dash of sulphur, clean floral and spicy hops. Lightly sweet, decently bitter. Medium bodied, decently active yet soft toward creamy in mouthfeel, with a clean and dry floral hop finish. I cannot get enough of this style and while Im absolutely certain from all Ive read and heard on this site and elsewhere that the Zwickels and Kellers of Franconia are the quintessential examples, I find this to be outstanding of its own right due to its subtle complexity and all around enjoyable drinking experience.

Pours a slightly hazy yellow with a thin white head. The aroma is mellow and inviting. We find grassy hops, lemon, yeast, and a bit of spice. The taste is dry with hints that are both sweet and tart. Similar to the nose, grass and lemon factor heavily in here, along with bread, a bit of a cereal flavor, and hints of spices. The aftertaste is a short lemon. This one is light to medium in body, smooth in texture, and average in carbonation. This was very easy to drink and went down very well. It wont be the most complex beer youll find, but its solid. As a minor note, this came in a pretty cool pull top can.
Draught @ Albion. Faintly cloudy golden yellow with creamy off-white head, faint malt aroma, high carbonation, slightly sour yeasty malt taste, thin body, abrupt finish. Fresh and easy to drink.

16oz can. I imagine this one is in the backlog. Hazy orange-tan body. Steady thin off-white head. Peppery spicy hops, super clean golden malt. Zesty mouthfeel and carbonation. Supremely sessionable stuff. Hints of earthiness, but really great hop balance. Solid, but doesnt really have the malt character of a true German example.  Also has some micro floaties.

Pours a clear golden color with small white head and very little lacing. Aroma has bready malts, grass, and slight hops. Taste is slightly sweet with a dry finish. Body is light to medium with a crisp mouthfeel and slight carbonation. Very refreshing and well crafted. If I had blind taste-tested this, I would have insisted that it was German.

My 2nd ucbc brew, and wow. Golden color pour with a thin head. Havent seen any comments about the sediment but it is def unfiltered with lots of lil floaties. Very pulpy but the taste is so good. Its clean with a mild spice. Maybe a touch grassy. No strong aftertaste leaves me thirsting for more. Pleasing and not overpowering this one is refreshing for any occasion.

Draft, Granite City Brewing Downtown Indy. Pours a clear gold body with a wispy white head. The nose is clean pale malt with a touch of hops. The flavor is ok, slightly fruity with pale doughy malt, minimal hops. Light bodied with soft fizzy carbonation. A little grainy on the finish. Meh, not the best exams of the style, but drinkable.

Simply one of my "Go To" beers. Excellence of this style. Pours a deep gold and cloudy with moderate white head, dissipating. Good lacing remains throughout. Well-balanced. A great beer any time of year, especially summer - Prost to Florian!
Keg at the Midtown location, 12/17/16. Slightly hazy gold, large creamy white head, good retention. Aroma of doughy malt and mild grassy hops. The taste matches. Medium bodied, crisp, well balanced.

Bottle pour into nonic pint glass. Appearance is clear yellow/light brown, nice sparkle, finger-width white foamy head with fair retention and fair lacing. Aroma is cracker pilsner malt. Taste is rich, almost fatty, cracker/biscuit--like a wheat thin--with mild tart. Palate is light-to-medium bodied with airy, frothy texture, soft-to-average carbonation and finish as taste. Overall, certainly European-inspired and good for the style.
Very well made lager here. Traditional, to style with a good hop bite and some mineral and bread notes in the body.

Can from Milk and Hops, Chelsea, 11/10/16. Pours a mostly clear golden color with a small, fizzy head. Nice malty aroma, lemons, grains, and earth. Bit of grass. Moderately sweet, clean, easy drinking. Lightly dry close.

Pours yellowish-greenish with white off top, medium lasing. Aroma of sweet malt-hop mash, very ale alike thou, not like lager. Taste is light to medium sweet, light to medium hoppyness but not much bitterness, just light one. Medium+ body, but it didnt mess with drinkability. Kinda liked it. Easy going beer. I would say good balance slightly towards hoppyness makes it cool.

Golden color. Very pleasant slightly sweet nose with honey, cereal and slightly grassiness. Very clean nose. Malty forward lots of cereal notes, but good grassy hops backing things up. Feels pretty authentic, like right from Germany. Good example

Can. Losing your soul mate is hard enough. But 5 days after also watching your hometown losing Game 7 to the fucking 108 year old goat-curse believing North Siders (after being up 3-1 no less) and on the eve of a possible apocalyptic election scenario, the after work beer choice was all the more difficult. Picked this because I still have to walk my kid to school in the morning before I vote. So yeah... pale straw yellow pour, generous white head with excellent retention. Nose is grassy, Meyer lemons, grainy malt. Mouth is medium bodied, mild malt sweetness, toasty grains and some grass. Goes down super easy. So far I like here this Urban Chestnut brewery. Proves not every brewer in St. Louis is a profit driven, horse shit shoveling mega-corporate malt-based Nazi regime ;-)



Provided the world doesnt end before then, next season is the Tribes year. In the meantime, dont forget to vote.
není to můj úplně oblíbený pivní styl, ale v rámci kategorie se jedná o dobré pivo. Pro milovníky sladkých piv s minimální hořkostí to pravé...
Golden and clean. Light and malty with cardboardy background. Hay and aroma aroma with a sweet finish.

500 ml can from BOTW. Pours a cloudy bright gold with a large, airy head that quickly goes to lace. Nose is lemon, biscuity pilsner malts, nice. flavor is sweet, bready malts, grassy hops, and unfortunately, hints of DMS. Medium body, rounded, nice level of carbonation. All nice except the DMS. Should have served it ice cold.

This makes a beautiful glass of beer. Very good and absolutely no bitterness at all which greatly surprised me...the color alone lead me to think it would be bitter so I was very impressed. Its a much lighter brew than my palate is accustomed to yet it was pleasant and will lead to my enticement to try more lagers.

At the Good Life. The aroma is grass, bread. The appearance is yellow, white head. The flavor is sweet, bready, grassy. The finish is spicy, grassy. Medium in body. Really nice reresentation of the style.
On tap at Haymaker. Nice gold body with medium head. Nose is malty, yeasty. Taste is malts, spices and bitter in the finish. Pretty good.
From a can: pours yellow head with a slightly hazy body. Aroma is bread, sugar... Nice and delicate really. Taste is pretty light. Low hops. Nice sweetness. Refreshing. Quality.
Draft - pours yellow white head - nose/taste of bread malt, light spicy yeast and sugarcone - medium body

Pours a filtered, golden-amber color with a small, froth head.

Smells almost completely muted, with just the faintest hint of sweetened dough being recognizable. 

Has a lively carbonation among a body so light, that, just as on the nose, almost no flavors become recognizable. 

Does not provide any taste evolution at all, while the beers straw flavor turns thin and thinner, creating a watery taste. 

This reminds me of why I turned away from industrial made Lagers, as this taste nothing but boring and dull. The annoying thing about it to me is, that this got brewed by a small operation I had put high hops in.
Geruch nach Popcorn und ein wenig nach Karamell. Der Geschmack geht in Richtung Korn, Popcorn, im Hintergrund ist etwas Pappe.
Goldig, leicht trüb. Geruch nach Apfel. Eher wässrig, trocken. Kantig-kratzige Bittere. Dazu Hefebittere.

500 ml bottle (and more American brewers should do these 500 ml bottles dammit, theyre cool) from Woodmans in Janesville, WI, sampled in a Zywiec lager glass. Why do I point that out? Because everything contributes to the experience. Like, Im not listening to music now, its quiet with just a bit of traffic from the highway .5 km away and yes Im one of those pretentious Americans who insist on the Metric system even though family members threaten to punch me - anyway, and soon Ill be drinking this as I clean up from dinner of hasenpfeffer, spaetzle and beets. Zwickels a good cleaning beer, not too demanding but enough body and heft that I dont want to pound it, and then not get through the dishes until morning. Speaking of which I just happened on a review from a guy I used to know, I closed my eyes and she slipped away....sorry, Proustian moment, within a Proustian moment, and anyway, this was a review of a beer Ive had, and it was dead wrong, and Im convinced it was because the reviewer was dead drunk at the time. Shame on you C______! Getting back to the beer here, and my glassware fetish: a Zywiec glass holds just enough so that Ill have to do two pours, also slowing me down. Anyway this is a lightly hazy/oily golden/amber with a smallish head that does not last; the aroma is grassy, a bit weedy, faintly sour but also with a modicum of honey. On the palate its bready, sweeter than the New Glarus I had a couple of days ago, with a very short, slightly metallic, dry finish. Really only the faintest hint of those Hallertau hops - this is all about the malts which alas dominate a bit much in this grassy-biscuit flavor profile, which gives a rather cloying profile when it warms up even to cellar temperature. Its overall certainly drinkable but to my taste far from a great example of the style. I have a feeling this would come off significantly better on draught.

Bottle from Julios. Pours out a hazy medium golden color. Pillowy off white head settles to a thin lace. Rich malty profile. Earthy apple spice notes. Lots going on here for a lager. Quite tasty. Long dry finish.
Sampled at EatBar DC pours a hazy yellow with some thin, white head. Nose has yeast, bread, butter, cracker, grass. Flavor follows, some cracker and biscuit, a little lemon, straw. Crisp finish.

Nett, einfach nett. Aber auch leicht bieder mit einer recht starken Perliung, einem trockenen Gaumen und einer angenehmen Frische und Knackigkeit. Einfach zu trinken, mir aber etwas eintönig, dabei jedoch handwerklich sehr gut umgesetzt.

Can at home. Pours lightly hazy gold with a medium, frothy white head, short retention with spare lacing. Aroma is heavy cereal malt, light yeast and spicy hops. Flavor is clean, moderate cereal malt, light spicy hops and bitterness, light yeast and a dry finish. Light body and moderate carbonation.

Where and how:  Bottle 500ml 
Aroma: very nice hop profile, pleasant front, hinted meadow herbs, flowers with touch of citrus 7+ 
 Appearance : 
Top: smaller yet dense lasting top.
Base: hazy, deep gold. 
Palate :  sadly a bit thin bodied yet beyond that very nice texture and work on it. 
Taste: as in aroma in short  very nice. Refreshing friskier front, light freshness, easy going with softer mellower end. Stared very good, finished as great brew.
 other notes  world class creation.
Draft at Churchkey thanks to solidfunk. Poured a golden yellow color with a medium sized head. Aroma was mild fruity notes. Crisp grain, grassy notes. Clean finish.
Light butter and some lightly candied barley malt. Hazy golden pour with good head and lacing. Smooth clean finish. Easy drinking. Tap at Churchkey.

Keg at BBs - St. Louis. Pours clear gold with a frothy, white head. The nose holds candied grains, some ripening citrus, cereal. Light to medium sweet flavor with more cereal, light bitter hay, impressions of pale bread, biscuits. Light bodied with average carbonation. Crisp finish with more cereal, biscuits, straw and light apple notes. Nice overall.
Bottle from local rewe. The beer has got a hazy amber colour with a steady head and medium body. Aroma of hops and biscuits. Taste Of hops, straw, bread, biscuits and pine. Hoppy finish. Nice one.

Slightly cloudy, golden pour with a single finger head. Visible carbonation. Aroma is bright and floral with hints of bread or biscuits. Medium bodied. Taste is on the malty side with hints of cereal. Very clean with a slightly bitter finish. Very easy drinking. No lace present.

500 ml bottle. Medium gold color topped by a large foamy white head. Nice clinging lace. Grainy malt aroma has hints of lemon and fresh baked bread. Crisp grainy sweet malt flavor upfront. Notes of bread and lemon zest. Finishes with subtle citrus and spicy hops.. Clean, crisp and refreshing. Very much in the German tradition.
Aroma is spicy German hops, malts and very German in nature all around. The flavor is malts, light fruit and a long mildly spicy German hops/citrus finish.
Bottle @ Hopfen & Malz, Berlin. Pours slight unclear golden with a white head. Grass, breadcrust and vague citrus. Crisp and clean. Boom. Incredibly tasty quaffer!

Bottle 500ml. @ home. [ As Urban Chestnut Hallertauer Zwickel Hell ]. [ Brewed by Urban Chestnut Hallertauer Brauerei, Wolnzach, Germany ].ABV: 5.0%. Unclear medium orange yellow color with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white head. Aroma is moderate malty, grain, pale malt, fruity malt, light to moderate hoppy, grass, light sour malt. Flavor is moderate sweet and light bitter with a average to long duration, grain, sweet malt, pale malt, grass, light fruity - citrus. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20151231]

Wheaty grainy nose with noble hop notes. Medium amber clear with thin off-white lacing head. Medium body with medium-high carbonation. Starts medium dry with wheat and pale malt sweetness. Noble hop bite, carbonic acidity, and light hop finish
Aroma and taste of bread, light malts and some hops. Nothing special and boring though refreshing.

Purchased at Bottles and Cans in Chicago, IL; enjoyed at home on a nice Monday late winter evening. Appearance is a pale yellow with a robust white head. Aroma mostly of lager yeast. Taste goes down nice and crisp with a yeasty profile. Not bad.

UPDATED: JUL 9, 2016 Urban Chestnuts Zwickel tastes like it arrived straight from Germany. Bread-like lager yeast, sweet grains, and lingering corn in the finish. Light-bodied feel with plenty of carbonation. Not hugely complex, but enjoyable and true to the style.

Draft/Fest.

A- Corn, grains, lemon.

A- Gold color, clear liquid, white head.

T- Corn, grains, slightly sweet.

P- Light body, average texture, average carbonation, boring finish.

O- Pretty bland. I just think I really dont like the style. Might as well have been a PBR.

On tap at the Hilton in St Louis. Clear gold pour with thin lacy white head. Aroma is grainy, light grassiness, very clean, fresh bready notes. Taste is grainy, light, malty, very light dusty hop. Palate is light bodied, dry, good carbonation. Very clean easy drinking lager.

Can at Revolution. 

Golden with a white head. On the sweet side with grain, grass, bread and some light hops. Drinkable but nothing special.

Light amber. Medium low head. Yeasty aroma. Taste is a hint off sweet honey, a little grain and grassy hops which gets stronger towards the end. Taste stays an appropiate long enough time. Palate is thin which fits the style very well. Nice,
Very clear pour for a zwickel. Other than that, no complaints. Delicious. Light and fruity. Like Froot Loops. Light and crushable. Loved it.

On tap @Birre sotto lalbero, Ma che siete venuti a fà (Rome). Pours golden with a decent white head. Aroma is malty, bread crust, honey, herbal notes, grass. Flavour is medium sweet with a decent bitter end. Medium to light body, light carbonation. A bit shy, I expected more.
Aroma of grassy dry hops, dry bready yeast, and grainy malt. Taste of lager yeast, stale honey grain bread, with a strong hop bitterness. Very similar to some German/ European Lagers Ive had.
Bottle by Beerhunter111. Lightly hazy yellow colour. Slightly honeyish and lemony flavour. Rather thin bodied, easy drinking. Refreshing. Good.
Bottle from trade with Beerhunter111, many thanks. Unclear golden color with medium white head. Malt, very light hops in aroma. Malt, some fruits, yeast, very light hops in finish.

Bottle from fonefan as Urban Chestnut Hallertauer Zwickel Hell. Clear golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and light hoppy - fruity. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 221215
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are rich hops, grass, sweet malt, flowers and has a nice balanced sweet finish.

Pale yellow beer with an audibly fizzy white head. Lots of carbonation rising in the beer throughout. Clean, earthy nose with some bread crust notes. This is a light, easy drinking beer with bread crust and some grainy malts with an earthy, straw finish. Not too interesting and Im sure would be better on a hot day with a pretzel.
Bottle, Wolnzach version. Cloudy, light floaties. Slightly yeasty, grassy nose, fairly restrained. Medium light body, not chewy enough. Pretty unspektacular finish. Needs more character.

Bottle from Julios Liquors. Consumed very chilled. Hazy golden color with standard Co2 level, spotty lace around the edges of the glass. Aroma of Noble hops, grain and skunky lager yeast. 
The flavor has a solid malt base with the Noble hops, skunky yeast and grassy notes. Ends on a mild sweetness. Straw hints. This is exactly as it would taste in Germany. A perfect example of the style.
Draft served in shaker glass. Dark yellow with a nice white head, pretty clear with medium body. Grassy flavor with a long bitter finish. Very interesting nuance to this, for a lager.
As Urban Chestnut Hallertauer Zwickel Hell. Cloudy golden color. Slight malty aroma. Somewhat creamy texture. Medium body taste with malty aftertaste.

500 ml Euro bottle into a dimple mug. Despite what the bottle says, I cant find a born on date. 

Aroma - Herbal hops, honey, fresh cut grass. Cereal (oat variety, hay. Fresh and bright. Lots of good things going on here. 

Appearance - Hazy gold. Fizzy, white head which comes as it goes. 

Taste - Sweet oat cereal/ grain and honey flavors initially countered by medicinal, herbal hops with a touch of citrus acidity. Finishes with a lasting grassy, lemon flavor. 

Palate - Light to medium bodied. Semi-dry. 

Overall - The world needs more unfiltered lager, with this one being a standard bearer.

Bottle from gregwilsonstl part of random box of beer trade. Cloudy gold with two finger white head. Nose is grainy and light citrus and floral tones. Tastes of florals, lemon, apple, bready, grainy.nice crisp and refreshing. Quite enjoyable.

0,5 l bottle bottled as Hallertauer Zwickel BB 22.01.16 
golden, slightly hazy, frothy, white foam, bread, cereal, herbs, citrus, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, oily feel, slick feel, average carbonation,

500ml bottle (as Hallertauer Zwickel Hell)

Pours golden orange with a small head. Aroma of grassy hops, earthy notes, bready malts and hay. Taste is crisp, grassy and earthy with some bready notes. Finish is crisp, grassy and malty with some earthy notes and hay. Okay.

500 ml bottle. Pours a yellow colour with a small foamy head. Aroma of grainy malts, grassy hops and honey-like sweetness. Flavour of crisp grassy bitterness, honey, yeastiness, herbal notes and grass. Light bodied. Bright and refreshing. A bit too sweet.

50 cl bottle. BBE 22.01.2016.
Pours clear golden color with a small head. Grassy aroma, pale malts, some mild fruity notes and subtle hops. Grassy and malty flavor, some subtle grain notes, hay and earth. Quite boring.
3323

50 cl bottle (5.0%) @ home, BBE 22.01.2016
Aroma is somewhat musty with grassy hops and buttery malt. Also hints of nuts. Flavour has grassy hops, mint, some biscuits and minerals. A bit leathery finish with bush leaves; feels slightly old. Somewhat refreshing still.

Pours slight hazy yellow with a small white head. Head retention is ok. AROMA: crisp malt, grass bitterness, herbs, leaves, light citrus, hay, herbal hops, yeast esters, spices, light honey and earthy. TASTE: crisp malts, grassy, herbs, leaves, spices, honey, citrus, hay, orange, earthy, light hop bitterness/spice and light peppercorn. AFTER TASTE: crisp malt, grassy and earthy with a slightly oily crisp finish.
Pours a clear yellow with a white head that leaves lacing. Nose is faint cereal. Tate is light pilsner malt with very fain bitterness. Half liter bottle No "Born On Date" visible.
UPDATED: MAY 14, 2017 From BandC. Lovely lager. Not as yeasty as I expected. Soft palate, herbal hops. Fruity, nice. Serving: Bottle
Pours gold into a Sam glass. Bright white head with little retention recedes to sicken surface leaving spotted sheets. Earthy malt aromas. Soft with caramel and sourdough front to back.

(bottle) Hazy, pale golden colour with a big and blond foamy head. Yeasty, malty, slightly biscuity and doughy aroma with herbal and subtle fruity hops. Mildly bitter-sweet flavour, light bodied with a moderate carbonation. Soft malty base with hints of biscuit, white bread, backed by a mildly herbal-spicy hoppy touch; dry-ish mildly malty and slightly hop bitter finish with doughy and subtle grainy spots. Likeable. 27.IV.15

500 ml bottle as Urban Chestnut Hallertauer Zwickel Hell. BB 22/01/16. Thanks to Timo A!
Cloudy pale yellow color with a tiny white head. 
Mild grassy hops, mild sweetness, earthy notes and malt in the aroma. 
The flavor is grassy hops, mild bitterness, earthy notes and malt. Very drinkable.

Euro2-Flasche: Golden, hazy to cloudy, mid-sized lacy off-white head; spicy herbal-hoppy nose with a piney touch, some fruity yeast in the background; mild to moderate bitter-sweet flavour, almost medium bodied, pretty soft; slightly lingering bitter-hoppy finish with a certain yeasty fruitiness. Nice brew

Cloudy gold with two inches of nice white foam. Nose has notes of grass, wheat, hay, with slight citrus. Beer is crisp, clean, and effervescent on the palate. Taste is malty in the middle with a clean mild hop finish, I would classify this beer as easily drinkable, uncomplicated, and sessionable. Overall this is a great representation of a simple beer expertly done.
7/227/15 (Bottle) Cloudy golden colour with solid thick white head. Mild yeast aroma. ight textures, goes down smooth and easy. Perfect for a hot day and with a meal. Overall very good beer.
Golden im Glas, leuchtend weißer Schaum, schöne karbonisierung, bitter in der Nase, frisch im antrunk, schöner Körper, angenehme leichte bittere, schönes helles, sehr gut drinkbar

Draft. Golden body with a frothy, off-white head, rapidly diminishing. Aroma of toasted grain, dusty grain, canned corn, vegetables, grass. The flavor is moderately sweet and lightly bitter. It finishes lightly to moderately sweet and lightly to moderately bitter. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation. Grainy taste. Too much DMS.
Pretty good. Has a good distinct flavor. Beer vacation has gone pretty well so far.
Hazy yellow color, medium white head. Nice aroma of floral biscuit. Taste is floral and citrusy Decent.

Nice aroma of toasty caramel. Nice yellow color with a huge white head. Sweet rich caramel up front. Smooth. peppery bitterness comes in next and is a perfect match for the sweetness. Slick mouth feel with nice carbonation. Finish is a combo of sweet and some pepper, urging you to got right back for more. Great lager.
The perfect drinking beer, nutty and malty, pleasantly sweet yet refreshing. Perfectly balanced. Really a pleasure to drink:
A surprisingly true-to-style zwickle. Cloudy yellow, straw and yeasty aroma. Very smooth yeasty flavour with decent bitterness.
Tap. Clear gold-yellow pour with a small white head. Hay, grain, grass. Really good for the style.
Draft at taproom. Pours clear yellow with a white head. Doesnt leave much lacing. Clean and crisp on the tongue. A bit of a hop note on the nose that suggests floral. Its certainly quaffable.
Draft at the jefferey nyc. Light tan color. Easy drinking session for a nice day. Nothing special

Draught at Torst. Almost clear light straw. Not much head. Aroma is classic hay, light bread, a bit of citrus. Flavor follows with light crisp pith and soft grain sweetness. Feel is watery and fast. Nicely done and easy.
Pours straw yellow with nice head and decent lacing. Smells of bread malts, dirt, earth, yeast. Flavor is crisp, light butter, bread, creamy malt. Like this.

Nose is nice and malty with bread and mineral notes and a little grass. Hazy golden pour nice frothy head and lace. Bread mineral and malty Flavors mostly here. Lingering pleasant sweetness. A little yeastiness in the finish. Nice beer.

Slightly hazy straw with a big, frothy head. The aroma is sweet bready malt and some mellow noble hops. The flavor is fairly sweet, with some lemony and floral hop flavors and a clean finish. Pretty good.

500ml bottle. Hazy, milky golden colour with huge, frothy, half-way lasting, minimally lacing, white head. Grainy aroma with protein accentuation, yeasty and minimally doughy, thereby fresh and airy. Taste is dry, grainy, husky, protein notes, a touch of lemon. A Zwickel as it shall be, reverence evinced.

Euro2-bottle from Bierpost. Hazy deep golden with a persistent white head. Dry hoppy nose. Light-bodied, good malty start with a nice yeasty-fruity touch and some dry, slightly dusty and also slightly resiny herbal hops in the finish. Good beer and true to the style.
Slightly cloudy yellow pour with a white head. Aroma is yeast and malt. Taste is dry, malt, biscuit, light and crisp. OK beer/.

Leicht trübes goldgelbes Bier mit einer schönen weißen Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr malzig, getreidig, leicht hopfig, grasig. Geschmack leicht grasig, hopfig, geringe Malzigkeit, gut trinkbar aber nichts besonderes.

500 ml. bottle. Pours a pale hazed holden with a medium white head. Aroma is yeasty and fruity, with fresh bready pilsner malt notes. Flavor is bready, yeasty. WIth mild fruitiness. Delicious, crisp, refreshing and very smooth. Medium bodied with smooth carbonation. Finishes fruity. Very nice.

Tap. Pours hazy golden, small white head, dissipates fairly quickly, somesome lacing. Aroma of biscuit, grain, grass. Flavor is light sweet, light plus bitter, touch of citrus, lemon zest. Medium body.
Tap at brewery with pals. .pours copper clear ..This stuff is akward..hostipatle syringe aroma and taste. Eww
Yellowish with white head. Bitter and slightly fruity. Haven't really liked any of their beers. Had this on tap as part of a flight at urban chestnut brewery.
bottle, great interpretation of the style, clean, crisp, light aroma,solid flavor. enjoyable sessionable offering

UPDATED: DEC 24, 2016 Appearance is a cloudy golden with a frothy white foam cap that dissipated quickly. Aroma is all pilsner malt, with no noticeable hop aroma. Taste is a bready pilsner malt with a moderate bitterness. Mouthfeel is medium to thick for the style, with a slight creaminess and moderate carbonation. Finishes clean and crisp with a slight residual bitterness. Reminiscent of a Helles, but with a creaminess from the unfiltered, bottle conditioned beer
Nice brew! Very yeasty. Great specimen of a Bavarian lager- a nice Helles cousin! Very enjoyable. Will have to buy more!

Bottle... Pours clear and golden with a small, fizzy, white head. Although Im trying really hard to pull something from the glass, I cant smell anything here. Light to medium-bodied with a slick mouthfeel and fizzy carbonation. The flavor is mostly-balanced and a touch bitter with a hint of buttery diacetyl in the otherwise crisp finish. The diacetyl actually helps here, because it doesnt really bother me and theres not much of anything else going on.

Pour on tap at the brewery, slightly hazy yellow pour with white head, aroma brought notes of grass, bread, biscuit, nice honey, hints of floral and spicy notes. Taste is a mix of grass, bread, biscuit, nice crisp crackery notes, some floral notes, finishing dry, clean. Nice version.

From bottle. 

Pours a nice amber with a couple fingers of white head. Decent lager - figure a Bud done right with a bit of a kick. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft to pils glass. Looks solid; a transparent gold with foamy white head. Smells of lager yeast and mild hops. Tastes like it smells with more of a yeast presence. A bit mineraly as well. Average on the palate. Not bad, but nothing to write home about.
Keg @ Urban Chestnut. Slightly hazy gold with a small head. Nice bread and light floral hoppiness. Fresh peppery hop flavor. Creamy malt. Sharp carb on the finish. Awesome.

Bottle sourced from one of their 4 packs. Beer wafts of bread, barley and weakly of hops. Appearance is a thick opaque blonde. Tastes like the best lager I have ever had. Not surprising, the owner of UBCB brewed a lot of ABs best beers for Michelob. Palate is refreshing as a well flavored lager could be the only thing this beer is missing is hops has too much grain/ bread taste.

Bottle at home. Properly chilled and served, but I had a gusher. About 30 seconds of foam pouring out. Oh well. Other than that...pours a hazy yellow. Aroma is wet grass and lemons. Light bodied. Nice beer apart from the gushing. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

16.9 oz bottle poured into a stemmed Belgian tulip glass. The aromas are a bit of wet towel, with some lemon, bread, and a salty / mineral quality. It pours a hazy unfiltered honey yellow color with a soft, pillow white head. It retains well with an abundant sheet lace. Its a lightly bitter beer with medium amounts of dry sweet. The waxy beer has a medium light body with a light amount of fizzy carbonation. If finishes mostly clean with notes of dry minerals, light lemon, bread, and a touch of salt. The aftertaste is very light and short.

Bottle. Pours a clear(isn) gold with a medium head and aromas of dough, honey and hay. Flavor is clean... a little dough, some honey and light bitterness, but nothing too interesting. Great beer for summer.
user_location: The Wet Side of a Dry Town, Pennsylvania, USA

text: On tap @ Urban Chestnut, thanks to Andy...cheers John. Clear golden pour with a white head. Really nice bready malt and floral hops on the nose. Good sweetness, some grass, and spicy hops. Slight bitterness on the palate. Tons of bread, hints of apple, and lots of floral hops. Slight earth and spice. Good all around.
Gold pour with creamy white head and lace. Aroma is fruity esters and clove. Pilsner malt flavor with floral hop notes on the flavor. Medium bodied but a touch foamy carbonation.

Draft @ Urban Chestnut Midtown Brewery & Biergarten, St Louis, MO. Pours a hazy yellow color with a white head. Has a fruity malty grainy weak grassy aroma. Fruity malty grainy weak grassy and weak yeasty flavor. Has a fruity malty grainy finish.

On draught a bunch of times this last weekend. 
Pours a hazy gold with a small head and good lacing on the glass. 

The aroma is dough with some nice herbal hoppiness, its got some wet limestone and mild malt character. 

The flavor is mildly bitter, grassy & herbal hops are pretty forward. The malt has a light toastiness and a touch of fruity character. The beer is a little yeasty, but in a good way. 

Good enough I bought a 4 pack of it, thought about grabbing the 12 pack, but sheesh... Ive got enough beer @ home.

4 oz draft pour at Urban Chestnut Midtown during RBSG 2014. Hazy golden yellow with off-white head. Aromas of sweet malt, citrus, caramel. Tastes of citrus, sweet malt, dark fruit, caramel. Medium-light body with a dry finish. Malty mouthfeel.

This rating is from bottle (even though I had some on tap too)...  YES the bottled version is far better, no idea why. Hazy golden hue with a fading head and spotty lace. The aroma is a beautiful confluence of pils malt, noble hops and minerally water. The taste is spot on with the nose, just bitter enough for refreshment and just enough mouth feel to make sure you know you are not drinking some blah lager. I can only imagine this is what bier was more modern advances got in the way. Glad I still have two more to enjoy... should have bought more. FYI, my tap rating would have been 3.7. I did detect a touch of DMS on tap, none in the two bottles I have opened so far.

Draft flight on tap at the brewpub (St. Louis, MO). Pours a nice golden yellow hue, gentle haziness, frothy whitish head is crisp, grainy and straw is dry, earthy green hops with gentle yeastiness. Criosp straw, grain. Initial is crisp, clean with nice bready malt, straw, fresh gentle yeast and bread dough. A touch crusty, some straw and gentle dryness. A touch powdery, earthy hops with green leafy bitterness. Backend is dry, crisp and cereal in nature. Light and airy, grainy with great drinkability. Nice stuff. Simple, clean, dry and crushable. Touch of fruit. Nice.

This is cloudy pils yellow in the glass with a pillowy head of foam. It has a big noble hop nose--floral and lighly grassy. Solid malt character helps bring out a bit of lemon as well. I found this a little overcarbonated but that had little effect on drinkability. The finish is nice and crisp w/ some lingering sweetness and earthy bitterness.. This is a really good beer but not quite spot on, esp. as far as the texture.

Sampled from the tap at the brewpub. Pours a clear light yellow with a white head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has a nice light grain with a bit of grass and a touch of earthiness. Flavor has a lot of light grains with a nice earthy grass note underlying. Great drink ability.
A golden colored beer with a small white head. The aroma is light grain, earthy, and fruity. The flavor is bready malt and lightly fruity.

Taster at Upland Sourfest. From a bottle. Clear golden color. Thin off-white head. Couple dots of lace. Wow. Awesome clean bready aroma, very satisfying. Full-bodied, yet refreshing. Awesome change of pace from the 100 sours today. Good mild bitter, moderate sweet. Badass Zwickel. Want to session this.
Draft pour at the source. Pours a pale gold with a white head of foam. Light corny aroma with some bready notes. Bready sweet taste. Light body and medium carbonation.

Draft sample at the Hyatt in St. Louis. Lighter beer. Light hops. Not my style but enjoyed it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sample at the Ale Wine & Spirits beer tasting on 04/03/2014: The beer is a hazy golden color with a medium fizzy white head that dissipates steadily. Strings of lacing on the glass. Toasted malt, spiced fruit and yeast in the nose. Light-bodied with flavors of biscuit malt, citrus and earthy yeast. The finish is grainy malt and subtle banana. Decent overall.

Another beer shared by Stan Hieronymus. Still geeked out. The beer had a rich translucent gold body with a film of white head. The aroma was herbal with some wildflowers; had a pastoral feel. Theres also a touch of white grape and maybe pear. The flavor brings much of the same; seems very traditional. The palate isnt quite as soft as the Hefe, but is still soft and creamy overall. Would really love to try this in person someday. Thanks again, Stan!

Bottle from a trade. Thanks! Pours a slightly hazy medium orange with a half finger of white head. Aroma is slightly yeasty with citrus. Taste is light sweet. Follows aroma with a hint of lemon and orange. Light bodied with a slightly slick texture. A bit fizzy on the carb and a decently long finish. Pretty darn good.
1/6/2014. On tap. Golden yellow with a white head. Corn, grain and malty aromas with light hoppy flavors. Mild and simple beer without any complexity, yet very drinkable.

This tasted as a standard pilsner. My understanding of the style is that it should have a darker color that the off-yellow of this one. Aroma was of grassy malts with some floral hoppiness. Decent but light mouthfeel. Easy to drink and crisp. Some hop bitterness up front with wheat type malts finishing out. OK but unremarkable. Would probably be better out of the cask.
Poured from pint bottle. Light golden color with light foamy head. A sweet bread aroma. Tastes of sweet grain with a citrus end. Overall a good Bavarian style lager.
Tap - fair size foamy head, light hazy gold color, pretty balanced aroma and flavor - light malt and hops with a slightly tart finish - not bad overall

I had this at Global Brew. Pours a cloudy gold with a white head. Taste sweet, floral. I thought this was good. I would drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from pump, thanks! Golden yellow with a large white topper. Aroma is grainy with toasted malt and mild fruit and citrus. Taste is on the sweeter side with bready malts, light fruit and light hops on the finish.

Pours hazy gold with a thin head and great lacing. Aroma is big dandelion floral and a faint bit of bergamot. Flavor is warm, toasty malts, with a hint of sweetness and a big grainy rush after the swallow. Some awesome yeasty dough and a grassy finish. Yes, please
Pours a hazy golden color. Almost like a opaque cream soda. Little aroma BIG fluffy head. Clean inoffensive taste and smooth watery mouth feel. Solid Lager/pilsner

A hazy light golden color with huge white head. Yeasty smell with a little funky hop and a little coriander, lemon. Taste is a smooth crisp light sweet with some coriander, yeasty, very little bitter, finishes smooth. An excellent summer to fall drinking beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
bottle..Pour is yellow with a small white head..Nose is grains, burnt honey, hay, nutty, toast..TAste is spice, hay, oats, nutty, hay, more honey, caramels
Which I could sit down with a session of this. Where it stands it is a good lager and one of the few in the style in the US.

Never had this style before; pretty good. Honestly they could've called it any style of German lager(dortmunder, helles, etc) and I wouldn't have known better. Very tasty though.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This is a classic lager. What it was meant to be. Pours dark straw with a nice white head. Malt predominates but a slight hop flavor balances. This is what a lager was meant to be. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Good, refreshing, and highly drinkable, this beer is a nice example of the style. Fairly light on the hops, mostly a malty, lightly sweet flavor to complement the medium gold and near white head.

Pours a hazy copper color with a firm head that fades to some lacing. Aroma of some malt sweetness, mild fruit and citrus, a bit of grain and spice in the background. The taste is a subtle mix of malt and fruity sweetness, with a bit of grain and spice in the background. Mild bitterness and the finish is quite dry. Has a fairly light body, crisp, smooth and refreshing. Nicely balanced. Enjoyable beer. A sessionable beer that goes down easy.

Tap at the brewery, pours a cloudy golden with a really thin head and no lacing, the aroma has a decent amount of banana and yeast on the front end and the flavor is much of the same, some spice and yeast in the finish, interesting.

2013 bottle to a tulip glass. Pours a hazy golden yellow with a fizzy whit head. Aroma is a little citrus and cracker, very light. Taste is light malt and biscuit with a little grain and grapefruit. No bitterness to speak of. Has a thin, slightly creamy mouthfeel. Very little carbonation. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a hazy golden yellow with a big white head with good retention and lacing. Aroma of light malt and biscuit with a hint of light fruit and yeast. Taste is biscuit with a slight honey and fruit sweetness and an underlying minerality. Soft mouthfeel and medium bodied with light/medium carbonation. Super drinkable and nicely flavorful for a lager.

Hazy golden beer. Tight white head. Aroma is light malt and grassy. Taste is crisp hops and malt. Nice tha kna's.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

(500ml bottle) Pours a clear yellow body with a small white head.  Aroma of nuts, grain, straw, and minerals.  Flavor of toasted grain, earth, grass, bread, and minerals.  Typically, I do not care for Zwickels.  This one is exceptionally clean and has great quality.  Good beer.

(16.7oz bottle thanks to bu11zeye) clear medium gold, wispy white bubbles. Nose of light sweet butter cream, cream corn, oats, toasty, very light on the hops, but german hops for what is there. Taste is light melba toast, light butter, oats, smooth, medium sweetness, almost imperceptible hops.
Floral, Fuji apples, slightly citric, a bit nutty. Aroma is quite nice. Crisp taste starts watery, hoppy finish, light body, tasty even though I generally dislike the style.

Draft @ Urban Chestnut A - Pours hazy gloden blond with a one finger white head. Ok retention, not much lacing. S - Grainy, with a bit of yeast. T - French bread, lemon zest, and a mild bitter hop quality. M - Light bodied. Crisp carbonation. Clean finish. O - Nice subtle character. Great sessionable lager.

Bottle. Pours with a clear yellow golden hued body with a large fluffy white head. Aromas are of baked bread, toast, malt, straw. Mildly grassy with some hop aroma (noble, grassy, spicy mostly. Flavors are delicate, malty, bready, clean, hoppy, grassy. Very, very clean, light minerality. A touch of ripe apple. Very tasty. Lightly grassy, smooth malt. Medium carbonation dry mouthfeel, lower body. Good!

Pours hazy pale straw with a large white head. Smells grainy, a little toasted, slight hops. Taste is grain, bitter, soft sweetness. Medium-bodied with a smooth texture and soft mouth-carbonation, Urban Chestnut Zwickel finishes with a little sweetness and is otherwise clean.

500 ml can. Pours a cloudy orange color with a small white head. A light nose of dough some light fruit. The flavor is crisp, light hops, big bready dough, some caramel, yeasty. Very good. Crisp and flavorful. I could drink a ton of this.
On tap at Green Lady.  Golden blonde with some light toasted malt and a bit of a yeast character.

Bottle Purchased april 2013 at Friar Tuck in Fenton, MO.  
Pours lightly cloudy bright yellow hue with a small fizzy white head with vigorous carbonation.  looks crisp and refreshing.  nose is mostly musty, slightly skunky/spicy hops, cereal grains, minerals, hay/grass and some lite lager yeast character.  flavors exhibit spicy hops, pils malt (bread, cereal), lite bitterness from the hops.  very crisp and refreshing brew here.  Finish has notes of hay, spicy hops and lots of grains.  Some mineral aspects show up in there as well long into the finish.  Ya know, most people here are all about big beers.  In the past year or two, i have realized that im more of a subtle/delicate beer king of guy (pils, saisons, APA, IPA, IIPA being my favorite styles).  I can say that this beer would be awesome on a hot humid STL day.  crisp refreshing and has quite a bit of character.

The appearance combines many gorgeous elements: a cloudy golden color, a large-grain dark sediment, and a large white head; also, the subtle aroma combines hints of wheat and dough yeast. The taste is mildly sour and slightly sweet, and the palate combines a medium body, average carbonation, slightly astringent finish, and a slick texture.
Bottle.  Lactic barley malt and hay aroma.   Hazy medium yellow with giant white head.  Mildly sweet lemon barley malt and moderately bitter herbal/hay flavor.  Pretty good.
Pours pale golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet malt. Flavor is sweet, grainy malt, lightly grassy, nice beer.
Bottle share at DLD. Nice solid barley malt aroma. Hazy yellow with a large white head. Barley malt and light lemony flavor. Medium body, moderate carbonation. Overall, very clean and crisp.

A clean and refreshing lager. Pours a cloudy straw with a thick white head. Minor noble hop spice but finishes smooth. Great summer time beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft.  Lightly hazed straw body with small white head.  Aroma is medium sweet, herbal/lemon, some spicy, light orange/bread.  Taste is medium sweet, herbal/lemon, bread, light orange, spicy.  Light body.
On tap at the brewpub.  Comes a hazy gold with a decent white head.  Aroma of malt, grain, and yeast.  Taste is malt, grain, yeast, a touch of citrus, and a touch of grass.  Very nice!

Pours a light hazy yellow color with a monster, white bubbly head and a lot of carbonation. Aroma has a modest grassy, lemon nose from the hallertau, light pilsner nose, some light yeast character as well. Flavor has a smooth grassy, lemon start with a light amount of bitterness which fades to a very nice pilsner grainy finish. Body is light, very fizzy and slightly sharp feeling from the high carbonation. Overall a very tasty brew. Wish it was an everyday beer as I enjoy the full flavor for such a light beer.

An extremely refreshing and flavorul lager. You think that these styles of beers dont have depth and flavor which in a why the do lack what you can find in IPAs and stouts. There is great flavor and depth here. Creamy body. Clean pour. Hazy as its says it to be. Yeasty and cereal-like. Refreshing.

Sampled on draft at the House of 1000 beers this beer poured a dark golden color with a huge creamy yellow-white head that lingered and left great lacing. The aroma was bready with a faint citrus note. The flavor was bready and a touch nutty with hints of lemon, egg white and pepper. Medium length yeasty citrus and pepper finish. Medium body. Fairly basic.

If you want an easy drinking German style lager, this is a solid choice. Nothing stands out; just a crisp, slightly hazy, straw yellow refreshing beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap at Urban Chestnut on Jan 11th.  Pours a cloudy golden color with white head.  Grainy, earthy, herbal flavors.  Alright, drinkable, but nothing special.

On tap at House of 1000. Wheaty grainy nose with noble hop notes. Medium amber clear with thin off-white lacing head. Medium body with medium-high carbonation. Starts medium dry with wheat and pale malt sweetness. Noble hop bite, carbonic acidity, and light hop finish.

Bottle.

Head is initially average sized, frothy, white, mostly diminishing.
Body is hazy medium yellow, bottle conditioned.
	
Aroma is lightly malty (grain/cracker, husks), lightly hoppy (flowers, herbs), with notes of DMS, linoleum, and detergent.

Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, lightly bitter.
Finish is lightly sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, moderately bitter, slightly unclean, husky.

Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation.

Seems like maybe some promise lies under the covers, but the clunky/industrial flaws are prominent and difficult to ignore (in both nose and mouth).  A drain pour, but at least the brewers heart was in the right place.
Reverence Series Lager.  True to bavarian style.  Tasted like a lager i had in Garmish back in 1999.  Puts many american lagers to shame.

Pours a slightly hazy golden with white head and moderate to heavy lacing. Bready, yeasty and toasted malt flavors on the nose with maybe a slight hint of caramel on the back. Mildly sweet, hint of bitterness. Slight herbal hop, but this is very much a malt driven beer. Medium bodied palate with moderate carbonation. Long malty finish that is very smooth. Very drinkable.
January 8, 2013 on tap at brewpub. Cloudy yellow pour with limited head. Aroma was grainy, yeast and malt. Taste was consistent with aroma with mild bitter finish. Very drinkable and good for style.

Bottle. Pours a hazy gold with a white head. Nose is fantastic. Big earthy malts, bread crust, toast and some soft hop in the background. On tasting, medium/light bitterness. Creamy body. Toasty and melanoidin notes. clean malt. Nice richness and really fantastic overall.

UPDATED: JAN 11, 2013 Bottle @ home, courtesy of jcnielsen. Thanks Jetson! Pours a fairly hazy, golden yellow appearance with a diminishing white head. Lemony, light veggie, straw, light creamed corn, a bit herbal aroma. Uh oh. Tangy, light to moderate DMS, herbal/straw, somewhat chewy malty flavor with a fairly dry finish. Off but not off in a really horrible way- maybe they can clean this up. Update: tried on tap at Urban Chestnut and the DMS is still there. Goddammit, I really wanted this to be good.

Nearly clear, warm gold with a tall, foamy, white head.
Scent is grain, malt, yeast....
Taste is slightly herbal bitter, grain/bread
Crisp, just slightly sour.
Very good, easy drinking beer.

bottle. lightly hazed golden body and white head.  sourish and sweet lemon, wheat, bread dough, spice / herbs, etc., but all with noticeable cooked corn DMS, very sulfuric, fizzy, acidic, etc.  nice to see them try a zwickl, and you can tell theyre getting the foundation close, but the off-flavors and aromas are difficult to take.

Draught at Urban Chesunut: Foggy lemon. Scattered foam with a jagged collar. Strong sulfur odors accompany a yeasty nose of dough and paint, with off notes of husky malt (burnt wood) and apple. Hint of DMS and metal shavings, and only a trace of hoppy nectar. Loose, prickly carbonation. Lemony hop twinge gives way to husky malt which discharges a burnt wood astringency, immediately displacing the crackery aspects. Hops are very oily with a spicy tickle. Abundance of doughy, vitamin-B-laden yeast deadens the brighter  shades of lemon. Unremitting huskiness ensures no brightness is to return. Floral softness shyly exudes, though the malt is continually lifeless with a papery, stale wafer-cookie dullness. Severely fuzzy and muddled throughout, with an uncanny void of malt, mineral, and hop vividness. Finishes wafery and dull with stewed apple and tacky paintlike yeast compounding the muddled nature, though a late but crisp mineral and hop nectar flourish somewhat salvages drinkability. Well, as a huge fan of Franconian lager, I couldnt have been more excited about this brewery. But I must say is this is a rather depressing example of zwickelbier!  Yeasty and unclean to the point of inducing nausea.  Sadly, considering  the other six or seven offerings being poured at the time of my visit all share the same general character to this one (unfinished, very muddled, unclean), its safe to say this is a brewery with its heart in the right place but perhaps lacking the brewing skills. And if it helps to add objectivity to my review, I drove a little over 2 1/2 hours each way to sample just this beer fresh from the source, as zwickelbier generally fares poorly in the bottle, which means I *really* wanted to like it. Oh well.
user_location: Blue Ridge Mountains, North Carolina, USA

text:
16.9 oz bottle pours hazy golden with a white head.  Aroma of bread, grain, malt and floral.  Taste is malt, bread and citrus.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

500 ml bottle courtesy of beastiefan2k.  The pour is mostly clear yellow golden, with a fluffy 3 inch white head.  The head falls with a small amount of soapy lacing.  The aroma is full fresh toasted cracker malt, nice gentle herbal mineral character, and hint of malt sweetness behind. The taste is the cracker malt, paired wonderfully with the herbal mineral, along with a nice spice, and the dry mineral finish.  The palate is medium bodied, un filtered mouth feel, and the dry mineral finish is a real highlight.  This is a great beer, directly up my alley.  Thanks Eugene.

UPDATED: NOV 11, 2012 500 ml bottle courtesy of Strykzone. Poured a cloudy butterscotch color with a big white had an very little lacing.  Nose is floral hops.  Medium body and a lively mouthfeel. The flavor is lightly bitter with some floral and grassy hops. Light bitter spicy finish. Good tasting and easy drinking.
Draft at urban, pours hazy yellow gold with foamy white head. Aroma has sour dough, lemon, fresh yeast. Flavors are really crisp and fresh yeasty bread dough, tingly feel. Very authentic, excellent.

Bottle. Hazy straw gold pour, big white head. Good retention/lace. Aroma of grassy hops, dough, lager yeast. Taste is sweet bready malts, spicy noble hops, yeasty, fruity. Palate is dry, crisp, bitter finish. Very nice.

500mL bottle from a 4 pack, how awesome is that?  Poured into a generic wine glass.  Pours with a small but firm head.  The color is a nicely hazy golden, cant see through it.  Aroma is a good lager dryness, herbalnes, and a clean white biscuit maltiness.  Flavor is the same with a hefty unsweetened startchy white bread maltiness.  Hops are in the background, herbal German hops, fall in line with the beer and are not obvious.  Nicely dry, clean, well lagered, not overly processed.  A nice felt mouthfeel but easy going down.  All this at under 5%.  Whats not to like?
user_location: HdG (past: NYC, KS, Rain City), Maryland, USA

text: On tap at GTMW - Pours yellow with a huge foamy white head. Nose is huge rustic grain, light honey, and a touch of floral hopping. Taste is the same, with a little more hops. Nice graininess. Thick and fluffy. Wow...awesome stuff.

Beautiful example of a simple German lager.  Lightly malty and hoppy on the nose, no off putting aromas to speak of.  Pours golden and slightly cloudy/opaque, gorgeous white head and continues to effervesce throughout the draught.  Easy drinking lager, drank cold from a glass, is the epitome of the style.  Essentially, takes the yard beer to the top of the class.

Draft notes from Lansdale Brew Fest.  Poured hazy gold with white clingy head.  Nose was pale malt, hopcitrus, with a smooth flavor of the pale malt, hopcitrus, complexity from the non-filtration, and this is a definite beer you could gladly drink all day.

Bottle from Wine & Cheese in Clayton, MO. Pours golden amber with a creamy white head. Aroma of light malt with some citrus/herb hop. Med body. Flavor is herb - probably noble hop - with some underlying citrus and pale malt. Flavor is actually rather strong, but its made of light things. Finishes pretty dry. Drinks quite well.
Clear gold pour with a white head.  The aroma is pretty faint with some wheat.  The light body is crisp and lively.  It has a mildly bitter taste with a semi-dry finish.
Sampled at 2012 Indianapolis Brew Ha Ha. Smooth, light, refreshing. Light body and easy to drink. A good summer beer.

My first time trying this local brew.  Great beer.  Not my usual preference but I found it easy to drink and refreshing.  A good beer for a day or night of casual drinking.  Smooth crisp and high quality beer.
Pours hazy pale yellow with white heas. Aromas of grassy hops, spices, some bread. Flavor of spices, grassy hops, and grainy malts. Easy drinking and well crafted.
A gorgeous, rustic, grassy-hoppy bitch of a lager. Dry, refreshing, plenty of spicy hop character, and an honest, grainy backbone. Right in my wheelhouse.

UPDATED: JUL 23, 2012 Thanks, Carter! Tasted on tap into shaker pint. Poured a cloudy golden color, persistent white head with some lace and lots of suspended yeast. Aromas of rising dough, fresh-baked white bread, graham crackers, black pepper, grass, leaves. Chalky, yeasty, grainy, lightly fruity, subtly spicy, pils-like, mild and balanced bittersweet. Light body, moderate carbonation, bready mouthfeel, crisp and refreshing lager finish. Delicious. I love this kind of thing, and cant wait until its available in bottles (any day now.) I think The Stables Zoigl was a little better but theyre out-of-business now, so that was obviously a minority opinion.
Pretty good for a lager, very light.  Sweet and malty.  Very low IBU.  Smooth.  Strong pils taste.

Draft at the brewpub, served in a real German steinkrug.  Looks to be dark golden colored with just a little bit of head.  But this beer brings me right back to the German countryside.  Bready malt with a neat bitter finish, I long for a pretzel or brat and brotchen.  May not impress those look for audacity, but this is solid classic beer and my favorite of the day.  (#4490, 2/24/2012)

On tap at the brewery.  Lots of fruity esters but disjointed.  The Hellertau plays its normal nice part, but the yeast seems to take over and mess this beer up a tad.  Of all the beers i enjoyed, this was lowest on the list of the taster.
Easy to drink. Basic beer.  Smooth with little aftertaste. Would definitely drink again.
draft... bright and clear gold body... not much to say about this beer, good enough zwickel, just not a style I appreciate

Draft sample. Poured clear golden color with an average fizzy white head that mostly lasted with fair lacing. Moderate floral hop and malt aroma. Light to medium body with a smooth dry texture and soft carbonation. Medium sweet flavor with a medium swwet finish of moderate duration. Good soft beer.
Cloudy golden with creamy white head.  Nice lacing. Lemon and mild grain aroma.  Full body with mild carbonation. Medium bitterness and moderate dry finish.

Sample from beer fest. Poured a very hazy yellow color with a pillowy white head. Aroma was citrus and grains. Some banana as well. Spicy and citrus flavor. Some hops in the finish. Above average beer.
It poured a bright yellow color with a white head. The aroma was very malty. The flavor was about the same. A great Saturday afternoon beverage.

UPDATED: FEB 4, 2013 Lightly hazy golden color with a medium sized, white head that left light lacing on the glass.  Aroma of toasted malts, citrus, grains, toffee, and grass.  Taste of toast, grains, toffee, grass, light citrus, and medium bitterness.

Draft at the brewery.  This is hazy and golden.  A lemon grass and bready aroma.  Some grain is tasted with gentle hops with light fruit and flowers.  There is a hint of spice.  This is subtle and tasty.  I love the low ABV.

Cloudy gold pour with a thin white head. Dry, bready aroma with some grassy hop notes. Taste is light bready malts, and very light hints of caramel, bread, and hay. Grassy hop finish, with a clean sort of earthiness. Palate is light and very quaffable. Im not familiar with the Zwickel style, but Id say this one is similar to a light maibock. Pretty nicely drinkable.
tap at urban chestnut.    served in a ceramic mug.     to style dry toasted nutty rustic dough malt backing.    a touch of herbal hops.  pretty good.  sessionable.    like.

Draft at Capones with Pat and Dallas. Pours a clear yellow body with light white lacing. Aroma is wheat and German lager tones. Mouthfeel is thin and light - somewhat refreshing, but a bit dull - notes of pilsner malts, dry hops, bland German Wheat.
On tap at Capones. Poured a medium yellow color with a small sized white head. Aromas of grains, with lighter citrus. Tastes of grains, bread, citrus, and floral.
Clear straw yellow with a tall white head.  Aroma of lemon and grain.  Smooth with a mostly lemon flavor with hints of spice and grain,. One of the better ones Ive had in this style.

Sampled at the St Louis Brewers Heritage Festival.  Slightly cloudy pale yellow with very little white head.  Bready aroma.  This is a sweet pale pils, smooth and easy drinking for summer.  Quite good.

Pour is a bright cloudy yellow with a large white head.  Aroma is super dry with a cracker malt.  Flavor is more of the same.  A ton of dry bready malt with what Im guessing is a spicy saaz hop.  Finishes very clean and you could deffinatly put away a few of these on a warm afternoon.
Draught at PI on Delmar. Yellow and hazy. Light with a bit of fruitiness to the overall taste. Enjoyable for a warm day. Very drinkable.
(draught) ? hazy yellow gold (hard to tell in the stein) with nice white head. Malt aroma. Full body. Flavor is bready malt, hint of sweetness, and a little floral hops.

UPDATED: JUN 16, 2012 Pours clear light pale yellow with a white head.  The aroma has light pale malt with no hops bitterness detected.  It is lightly bready and smooth.  Medium smooth body with moderate carbonation.  The flavor starts with smooth lager malt, very light toast and a bit of citrus.  The taste seems basic, but it is very well constructed.  The finish has a light bit of spicy hops and a touch of malty sweetness.  This is far from being a fireworks sort of beer, but a its a great no frills beer that will be a perfect summer afternoon beer. (7/4/7/4/15 - 3.7)  Feel the need to update this since the initial rating was a sample at a fest & Ive had it multiple times since and now in bottles.  I see nothing of the original rating notes that needs to be updated, but the consistency from this beer and flavors have really grown on me.  The one alteration I would make to my ratings the Hallertau hops giving more of a spicy presence to the taste.  This has become a bit of a benchmark for solid lagers to me.

Tasted 3/31/11. Sampler from the Brewpub. Hazy with a golden hue. A nice halo of white head. Aromas of popcorn and medium roasted toasty malts. Nice malty nose! Medium bodied with a fresh zing! Nice malty body. Solidly produced with nice use of the malts and yeast. Grassy and citrus hops juxtaposition with the doughy yeast. Fresh and well made!

UPDATED: JUN 17, 2011 Draft at the brewpub served in one of their steins (Wasandis is also served in this), so I didnt get a great look at the color looked like a slightly cloudy yellow-gold, and there was an uneven white head. Aroma of grassy hops, straw, butter, bready and pale malts, and yeast. Flavor followed suit for the most part, getting sweeter, maltier, and more buttery as it went down and warmed. Light-bodied, with medium carbonation and a grainy, malty mouthfeel. Dont know a whole lot about this style but it was nice and easy to drink. RE-RATE: Had it again at The Royale. This is still not a style I know much about but this is a great, sessionable beer. Id like to try more Z/K/Ls for comparison because I dont think theyd beat this.

Sample at the tasting room.  Pour is clearer than expected golden color with a medium white head that precipitates out solids on the the side of the glass.  Aroma is lightly floral with notes of grass, hops, light yeast, and a light sweetness.  Flavor is also grassy with light floral hop notes and distinctly yeasty finish with a faint sweetness.  An interesting offer, easy to drink.
